headline: Deviled Eggs with Horseradish
description: Add a kick to deviled eggs with a special addition of horseradish, along with dill weed and ground mustard, for a crowd-pleasing appetizer.
name: Deviled Eggs with Horseradish

recipeInstructions.text: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil; remove from heat and let eggs stand in hot water for 15 minutes. Remove eggs and cool under cold running water; peel eggs. Slice each egg in half lengthwise. Remove yolks and transfer to a medium bowl. Place egg whites on a serving platter.
Mash yolks with a fork. Stir in mayonnaise, horseradish, dill, dry mustard, salt, pepper, and paprika. Spoon equal amounts into egg whites.

review.reviewBody: This is the only Deviled Egg recipe I use now. Very tasty!
Loved this recipe, did not change anything. I will be making these again, absolutely!
This was great! Big hit at a garden party I just threw. I made three different deviled eggs recipes, and this was my favorite. I added a bit more dill to the garnish than what is shown in the photos.

I made these eggs for Easter. I followed the recipe with the exception of adding some finely diced red onion for a little crunch. 
 Everyone liked them. The horseradish adds a nice bit of spice. I'll use this recipe when I want to change things up from our traditional deviled eggs that use prepared mustard and sweet pickle relish.
Followed directions, no good, lots of waste
Eggcellent!!!! I didn't have full but I'll add that next time.
I made these with the horseradish but also added some pesto (just the jarred) minis the mustard, for my son's birthday. They were also really good too. Thanks !
Not the best I have ever had, but very good.

For our taste, there was a tablespoon too much of horseradish, so I added a tablespoon or so of extra mayo to tone it down. Then I added about a teaspoon of sugar. Didn't have fresh dill, so used about an 1/8 teaspoon of dill seed. Yummy! Will definitely make it again.

These were just OK for me. I felt like it needed something else; I only had dried dill, so maybe fresh would have given them more oomph. I felt like there was too much salt and pepper--you may want to just shake in some of each instead of measuring. Thanks anyway.
Made as written and I loved the simplicity of these. Horseradish and dill are always a plus for deviled eggs in my book. Great recipe!
Easy and delicious! The family loved them...a keeper! Thanks for sharing,. :)
